conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows extruded walls with thickness, visible side faces and interior volume, in a slightly oblique/top-down cutaway view with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; cutaway is clean. View is only mildly angled (near top-down), reducing perceived 3D depth slightly.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall cluster of rooms roughly matches (stairs top-left, bath/WC near center-top, bedrooms to the right), but the balcony space at bottom-left is not faithfully represented and appears converted into an interior room; some wall runs/partitions and proportions around the left/bottom-left zone differ from the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Beds and living/activity furniture are present; bath fixtures are present. Kitchen elements are not clearly represented. Some furniture-to-room mapping is questionable due to the balcony/extra-room mismatch.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors are distinguishable and geometry is clean with a consistent material style. Lighting is adequate; minor ambiguity in openings/door locations due to viewpoint and simplified details.

detected_errors.description: Balcony area from the 2D plan is not faithfully modeled as an exterior balcony; it appears as an enclosed interior room/space in the 3D render, altering layout and adjacency.
Door/window placements and opening sizes are not consistently verifiable/matched to the 2D plan due to simplification and limited visibility.

summary: This is a true 3D cutaway conversion, but notable layout fidelity issues—especially the missing/incorrect balcony representation—prevent a higher score.
